# DDDiscoveryExtension

**Protocol**

A specification that enables the framework to start and stop the extension’s discovery process.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol DDDiscoveryExtension : AppExtension
```

## Overview

Your extension adopts this protocol as the primary entry and exit points for device discovery.

The system calls your extension’s [doc://com.apple.devicediscoveryextension/documentation/DeviceDiscoveryExtension/DDDiscoveryExtension/startDiscovery(session:)] when [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVKit/AVRoutePickerView] displays so your extension can include a specific third-party device in the picker. When the picker UI dismisses or the user selects a device, the system calls your extension’s [doc://com.apple.devicediscoveryextension/documentation/DeviceDiscoveryExtension/DDDiscoveryExtension/stopDiscovery(session:)] implementation to instruct it to perform any cleanup.

## Controlling discovery

- **startDiscovery(session:)**: Begins the extension’s device discovery process.
- **stopDiscovery(session:)**: Ends the extension’s device discovery process.

## Observing state changes

- **didReceiveEvent(_:)**: Provides a device event from the system to the extension.

## Extension

- **DDDiscoverySession**: An object that relays device discovery events from the extension to the system.
- **DDDiscoveryExtensionConfiguration**: An object that manages the extension’s communication with the framework.
- **DDDiscoveryExtensionConfigurationProtocol**: A specification that provides a communication channel between the extension and the framework.

## Inherits From

- AppExtension
